item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市在全球关税驱动的大跌中下跌
印度资产表现优于亚洲，关税打击被视为温和
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税措施被认为对印度经济增长和企业利润的影响较小，因此印度资产周四受到的冲击小于亚洲同行。【原文：Indian assets suffered less than their Asian peers Thursday after President Donald Trump’s tariff measures were perceived as less severe on the nation’s economic growth and corporate profits.】

item.title: 美国关税对中国的冲击远甚于第一次贸易战
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）最新的关税上调措施有可能对中国经济造成比其第一次贸易战期间更大的打击。【原文：Donald Trump’s latest tariff hikes threaten to inflict a bigger hit on China’s economy than it suffered during his first trade war.】

item.title: 美国加征关税导致亚洲出口商与越南工厂股价下跌
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对东南亚国家越南征收高于预期的关税后，在越南生产商品的亚洲公司股价下滑。【原文：Shares of Asian companies that manufacture goods in Vietnam slid after US President Donald Trump slapped higher-than-expected tariffs on the Southeast Asian nation.】

item.title: AirTrunk 寻求 17 亿美元贷款以建设新加坡数据中心
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Blackstone 旗下的数据中心公司 AirTrunk 正在为新加坡的一个新绿地项目寻求 22 亿新元（17 亿美元）的绿色贷款，因为该公司正寻求加强其区域扩张计划。【原文：Blackstone-owned data center firm AirTrunk is seeking a S$2.2 billion ($1.7 billion) green loan for a new greenfield project in Singapore, according to people familiar with the matter, as it looks to ramp up its expansion plans regionally.】

item.title: 美联社称美国禁止驻华工作人员与中国公民谈恋爱
item.description: 美联社援引知情人士的话报道称，美国已禁止驻华政府人员与中国公民发生恋爱或性关系。【原文：The US has banned government personnel based in China from having romantic or sexual relationships with Chinese citizens, the Associated Press reported citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 盈利预测未达预期，中东上市企业倍感压力
item.description: 中东地区的公司在首次公开募股中大获全胜，但却未能实现其崇高的盈利目标，这些公司正开始为此付出代价。【原文：Middle Eastern firms that rode the region’s boom in initial public offerings to only fall short of their lofty earnings targets are beginning to pay the price.】

item.title: 投资银行家称不确定性影响南非交易
item.description: 据南非一位顶级投资银行家称，南非政府内部的分裂以及全球宏观经济的不确定性正在拖累这个非洲大陆最大经济体的交易活动。【原文：Fractures within the South African government — along with global macroeconomic uncertainty — are weighing on dealmaking activity in the continent’s largest economy, according to one of the country’s top investment bankers.】

item.title: 美元短缺威胁莫桑比克的面包和燃料供应
item.description: 莫桑比克的外汇短缺已经影响到燃料供应，并有可能造成面包短缺。【原文：A foreign-exchange shortfall in Mozambique is already hitting fuel supplies and risks causing a scarcity of bread as well.】

item.title: 特朗普的 "互惠 "关税方案只关乎贸易赤字
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府主要根据现有的贸易平衡来计算一系列新的关税；这背离了与其他国家的关税税率和其他贸易壁垒相匹配的承诺。【原文：President Donald Trump’s administration calculated its raft of new tariffs primarily based on existing trade balances — a departure from pledges to match the tariff rates and other trade barriers from other countries.】

item.title: 比亚迪将把韩国销售网络扩大一倍，向现代汽车发起挑战
item.description: 比亚迪公司计划增加其在韩国的销售网络，因为韩国的汽车市场主要由本土品牌现代汽车公司和起亚公司主导，比亚迪公司正努力在其中国大本营以外的地区增加交付量。【原文：BYD Co. plans to increase its sales network in South Korea, a car market dominated by local brands Hyundai Motor Co. and Kia Corp., as it pushes for more deliveries outside of its home stronghold of China.】

item.title: 特朗普厌恶增值税。它们真的会让美国出口商处于不利地位吗？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）为惩罚他认为使美国制造商处于不利地位的美国贸易伙伴的做法而定制的新关税辩护时，特别将怒火集中在增值税上。大多数国家都使用增值税，但美国没有。【原文：In justifying new tariffs customized to punish US trading partners for practices he sees as putting US manufacturers at a disadvantage, President Donald Trump has focused particular ire on value-added taxes. VATs are used by most countries but not by the US.】

item.title: 在税收和最低工资上涨之前，英国企业关闭数量激增
item.description: 数以千计的英国企业在雇主增税和加薪之前申请破产，这对英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）平衡陷入困境的经济账目的努力是一个打击。【原文：Thousands of UK businesses filed for insolvency ahead of tax and wage increases on employers, a blow to Chancellor Rachel Reeves’ efforts to balance the struggling economy’s books.】

item.title: 欧盟誓言对特朗普征收 20% 关税采取反制措施
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对欧盟征收全面关税以瓦解全球贸易体系之后，美国最大的贸易伙伴欧盟誓言要进行报复。【原文：The European Union, the US’s largest trading partner, vowed to retaliate after President Donald Trump announced sweeping tariffs against the bloc in his bid to dismantle the global trading system.】

item.title: 泰国首富选择坏天气为其旗舰公司揭幕
item.description: 泰国首富可能为他新成立的旗舰公司海湾发展有限公司（Gulf Development Pcl）选择了一个糟糕的交易日。【原文：Thailand’s richest man may have picked a bad day for his newly forged flagship company, Gulf Development Pcl, to begin trading.】

item.title: 美国众议院稳定币法案在特朗普和民主党人的支持下取得进展
item.description: 周三晚，稳定币倡导者再次取得立法胜利，为华盛顿严重分裂的两党达成一致的少数问题之一增添了新的动力。【原文：Stablecoin advocates achieved another legislative victory on Wednesday night, adding fresh momentum to one of the few issues with bipartisan accord in a deeply divided Washington.】

item.title: 泰国总理称已准备好应对美国关税并计划会谈
item.description: 泰国总理巴东塔恩-西那瓦表示，泰国已准备好应对特朗普政府征收 36% 的所谓互惠关税所带来的影响，并补充说，东南亚国家将与美国举行会谈，以降低征税。【原文：Thailand is prepared to deal with the fallout of the 36% so-called reciprocal tariff imposed by the Trump administration, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said, adding that the Southeast Asian country would hold talks with the US to lower the levy.】

item.title: 特朗普关税给美国前景蒙上阴影，起亚首席执行官将目光投向欧洲
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的汽车关税和反电动汽车政策给美国的前景蒙上了阴影，起亚公司正致力于在欧洲销售更多的电动汽车。【原文：Kia Corp. is aiming to sell more electric vehicles in Europe as President Donald Trump’s auto tariffs and anti-EV policies cloud the outlook in the US.】

item.title: 日本称特朗普 24% 的关税令人遗憾，力促豁免
item.description: 在美国宣布对日本征收高于预期的新关税数小时后，日本贸易大臣表示，特朗普政府最新的关税大棒令人极为遗憾，并力促豁免。【原文：Japan’s Trade Minister said the Trump administration’s latest broadside on tariffs is extremely regrettable and pushed for an exemption, hours after the US announced new levies on Japan that were higher than expected.】

item.title: 关税施压，中国服务业增速回升
item.description: 一项民间调查显示，中国 3 月份的服务业活动有所回升，在美国额外关税给世界第二大经济体带来压力之前，这是一个值得欢迎的迹象。【原文：China’s service activity picked up in March, according to a private survey, a welcome sign before extra US tariffs pile pressure on the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 美国征收新关税，香港中国股市下跌
item.description: 在美国对中国几乎所有产品加征有史以来最大规模的关税后，中国股市下滑，人民币走软。【原文：Chinese stocks slid and the yuan weakened after the US hit the world’s No. 2 economy with the biggest-ever tariff hike on almost all of the nation’s products.】

item.title: 英国央行称美国关税强于预期，警告将出现波动
item.description: 韩国央行誓言将密切关注市场波动，并在必要时采取行动，称美国总统唐纳德-特朗普最新宣布的关税措施比市场预期的更为强硬。【原文：The Bank of Korea vowed to keep a close watch on market volatility and take action as needed, describing the latest tariffs announced by President Donald Trump as stronger than what markets were expecting.】

item.title: 美国征收新关税后，中国维持对人民币的支持
item.description: 在美国对世界第二大经济体加征有史以来最大规模的关税之后，中国央行保持了对本国货币的支持。【原文：China’s central bank retained support for its currency after the US hit the world’s No. 2 economy with the biggest-ever tariff hike.】
